premises: If unemployment rises, then consumer spending decreases
incorrect conclusions: Unemployment rises and consumer spending decreases
Consumer spending decreasing implies unemployment rises
Consumer spending does not decrease implies unemployment rises
Unemployment not rising implies consumer spending does not decrease

premises: If the government increases taxes, then disposable income falls
conclusions: The government does not increase taxes
incorrect conclusions: The government increases taxes and disposable income falls
Disposable income falling implies the government increases taxes
Disposable income not falling implies the government increases taxes
The government not increasing taxes implies disposable income does not fall

premises: If inflation rises, then the central bank increases interest rates
The central bank does not increase interest rates
incorrect conclusions: Inflation rises and the central bank increases interest rates
The central bank increasing interest rates implies inflation rises
The central bank not increasing interest rates implies inflation rises
Inflation not rising implies the central bank does not increase interest rates
